Air Elemental.name: Air Elemental
Air Elemental.description:
Your companion is an air elemental, such as a zephyr hawk.

Access You are a member of the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.classfeatures.Item.acqqlYmti8D9QJi0]{Storm Order}.

Size Small

Melee 1 gust (finesse), Damage 1d6 bludgeoning

Str +1, Dex +2, Con +1, Int –4, Wis +1, Cha +1

Hit Points 4

Skill Stealth

Senses darkvision

Speed fly 50 feet

Support Benefit Your air elemental swirls around you with concealing gusts, making it harder for your foes to hit you and possibly giving you a moment to hide. Until the start of your next turn, if you hit with a Strike and deal damage to a creature in your air elemental's reach, you are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} to that creature until the start of your next turn.

Advanced Maneuver @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-animal-companions.AC-Advanced-Maneuvers.Item.ePNzRvGvBqzIujJr]{Circling Flyby}

Ankylosaurus.name: Ankylosaurus
Ankylosaurus.description:
Your companion is an ankylosaurus or other armored dinosaur.

Size Large

Melee 1 tail, Damage 1d8 bludgeoning

Melee 1 foot, Damage 1d6 bludgeoning

Str +3, Dex +1, Con +2, Int -4, Wis +2, Cha +0

Hit Points 8

Skill Intimidation

Senses low-light vision, scent (imprecise, 30 feet)

Speed 25 feet

Special mount

Support Benefit Your ankylosaurus gores @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} targets in your wake. Until the start of your next turn, your Strikes that damage a prone creature in your ankylosaurus's reach also deal 1d8 persistent bleed damage. If your ankylosaurus is nimble or savage, the persistent bleed damage increases to 2d8.

Advanced Maneuver @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-animal-companions.AC-Advanced-Maneuvers.Item.H1ElYt6KovGYGzLD]{Lumbering Knockdown}

Note: This alternate version of Triceratops is provided by the module. It is granted the Triceratops support and advanced maneuvers

Antelope.name: Antilope
Antelope.description:
Dein Gefährte ist eine Antilope oder ähnliches Tier, z.B. eine Dik-Dik, Gazelle oder ein Gnu.

Größenkategorie Mittelgroß oder Groß

Nahkampf 1 Hörner (Finesse), Schaden 1W6 Stichschaden

Nahkampf 1 Huf (Agil, Finesse), Schaden 1W4 Wuchtschaden

ST +2, GE +3, KO +2, IN –4, WE +1, CH +0

Trefferpunkte 6

Fertigkeit Überlebenskunde

Sinne Dämmersicht

Bewegungsrate 40 Fuß/12 m

Speziell @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.PM5jvValFkbFH3TV]{Reittier}

Unterstützungsvorteil Die Antilope spießt deine abgelenkten Gegner auf. Bis zum Beginn deines nächsten Zuges verursachen Angriffe, die du auf deiner Antilope reitend führst und welche Gegnern im Angriffsradius deiner Antilope Schaden zufügen, zudem 1W6 Punkte Anhaltenden Blutungsschaden. Sollte deine Antilope ein Behänder oder Wilder Gefährte sein, steigt der Anhaltende Blutungsschaden auf 2W6 Punkte.

Verbessertes Manöver @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-animal-companions.AC-Advanced-Maneuvers.Item.yCbm5XbAzPc6U82H]{Springender Rückzug}

Ape.name: Ape
Ape.description:
Your companion is an ape or other primate.

Size Small

Melee 1 fist, Damage 1d8 bludgeoning

Str +3, Dex +1, Con +2, Int –4, Wis +2, Cha +0

Hit Points 8

Skill Intimidation

Senses low-light vision

Speed 25 feet, climb 25 feet

Support Benefit Your ape threatens your foes with menacing growls. Until the start of your next turn, if you hit and deal damage to a creature in your ape's reach, the creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.

Advanced Maneuver @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-animal-companions.AC-Advanced-Maneuvers.Item.0WtqP7Wei3AxHh5M]{Frightening Display}

Arboreal Sapling.name: Arboreal Sapling
Arboreal Sapling.description:
Access You are a member of the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.classfeatures.Item.u4nlOzPj2WHkIj9l]{Leaf Order}.

Your companion is a walking tree, a cousin of the great arboreal wardens and regents. An arboreal sapling has the plant trait instead of the animal trait, but it otherwise functions normally as an animal companion. They are typically only selected by animal order druids who are also members of the leaf order.

Size Small

Melee 1 branch, Damage 1d8 bludgeoning

Str +3, Dex +1, Con +2, Int –4, Wis +2, Cha +0

Hit Points 8

Skill Stealth

Senses low-light vision

Speed 25 feet

Support Benefit Your arboreal sapling plants roots around your foe, impeding its movement. Until the start of your next turn, if you hit and deal damage to a creature in your arboreal sapling's reach, the first square the creature moves into after taking that damage is difficult terrain.

Advanced Maneuver @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-animal-companions.AC-Advanced-Maneuvers.Item.tLUBgSE9Mm6ic6sY]{Throw Rock}

Augdunar.name: Augdunar
Augdunar.description:
Your companion is an augdunar, a powerful breed of mule favored by the dwarves of Highhelm.

Size Medium

Melee 1 hoof, Damage 1d8 bludgeoning

Str +3, Dex +1, Con +3, Int –4, Wis +1, Cha +0

Hit Points 10

Skill Athletics

Senses low-light vision, scent (imprecise) 30 feet

Speed 25 feet

Special mount

Support Benefit The augdunar shifts its weight, proffering you an item. You Interact to draw a weapon or item that is being carried by the augdunar.

Advanced Maneuver @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-animal-companions.AC-Advanced-Maneuvers.Item.IJYikMs3TzYGpdHm]{Weighted Kick}

Bacallia.name: Bacallia
Bacallia.description:
Your companion is an alpaca-like pack animal selectively bred for its lustrous fur.

Size Medium

Melee 1 foot, Damage 1d8 bludgeoning

Str +2, Dex +2, Con +2, Int –4, Wis +1, Cha +1

Hit Points 8

Skill Survival

Senses low-light vision

Speed 40 feet

Special mount; your bacallia ignores the harmful effects of mild, severe, and extreme cold or heat, selected when you gain the companion

Support Benefit Your bacallia's shining fur reflects light into your enemy's eyes. Until the start of your next turn, creatures within your bacallia's reach that you damage with your Strikes are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled}.

Advanced Maneuver @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-animal-companions.AC-Advanced-Maneuvers.Item.4T96OgDSKt16nRtV]{Spit}

Badger.name: Badger
Badger.description:
Your companion is a badger, wolverine, or other big mustelid.

Size Small

Melee 1 jaws, Damage 1d8 piercing

Melee 1 claw (agile), Damage 1d6 slashing

Str +2, Dex +2, Con +2, Int –4, Wis +2, Cha +0

Hit Points 8

Skill Survival

Senses low-light vision, scent (imprecise, 30 feet)

Speed 25 feet, burrow 10 feet, climb 10 feet

Support Benefit Your badger digs around your foe's position, interfering with its footing. Until the start of your next turn, if you hit and deal damage to a creature your badger threatens, the target can't use a Step action (unless it can Step through difficult terrain) until it moves from its current position.

Advanced Maneuver @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-animal-companions.AC-Advanced-Maneuvers.Item.HLD4JW6SUn5Oy8C9]{Badger Rage}

Bat.name: Bat
Bat.description:
Your companion is a particularly large bat, such as a giant bat.

Size Small

Melee 1 jaws (finesse), Damage 1d6 piercing

Melee 1 wing (agile, finesse), Damage 1d4 slashing

Str +2, Dex +3, Con +2, Int –4, Wis +1, Cha +0

Hit Points 6

Skill Stealth

Senses echolocation 20 feet (the bat can use hearing as a precise sense within this range), low-light vision

Speed 15 feet, fly 30 feet

Support Benefit Your bat flaps around your foes' arms and faces, getting in the way of their attacks. Until the start of your next turn, creatures in your bat's reach that you damage with Strikes take a –1 circumstance penalty to their attack rolls.

Advanced Maneuver @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-animal-companions.AC-Advanced-Maneuvers.Item.ODGf6brAHHKrSAPo]{Wing Thrash}

Bear.name: Bear
Bear.description:
Your companion is a black, grizzly, polar, or other type of bear.

Size Small

Melee 1 jaws, Damage 1d8 piercing

Melee 1 claw (agile), Damage 1d6 slashing

Str +3, Dex +2, Con +2, Int –4, Wis +1, Cha +0

Hit Points 8

Skill Intimidation

Senses low-light vision, scent (imprecise, 30 feet)

Speed 35 feet

Support Benefit Your bear mauls your enemies when you create an opening. Until the start of your next turn, each time you hit a creature in the bear's reach with a Strike, the creature takes 1d8 slashing damage from the bear. If your bear is nimble or savage, the slashing damage increases to 2d8.

Advanced Maneuver @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-animal-companions.AC-Advanced-Maneuvers.Item.oCgdnQP5bMDD02YC]{Bear Hug}

Beetle.name: Beetle
Beetle.description:
Your animal companion is a large, flightless stag beetle.

Size Medium or Large

Melee 1 mandible, Damage 1d8 piercing

Melee 1 foot (agile), Damage 1d6 bludgeoning

Str +3, Dex +1, Con +3, Int –4, Wis +1, Cha +0

Hit Points 8

Skill Survival

Senses low-light vision

Speed 35 feet

Special mount

Support Benefit Your beetle stomps around and smashes into foes, knocking them off balance or pushing them aside when you create an opening. Until the start of your next turn, while riding on your beetle, your Strikes that deal damage either make the target @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg] until the end of your next turn or move the target 5 feet away from the beetle (this is forced movement). The target chooses which effect occurs.

Advanced Maneuver @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-animal-companions.AC-Advanced-Maneuvers.Item.zSlsnbvsGKdCTzL1]{Hustle}

Bird.name: Bird
Bird.description:
Your companion is a bird of prey, such as an eagle, hawk, or owl.

Size Small

Melee 1 jaws (finesse), Damage 1d6 piercing

Melee 1 talon (agile, finesse), Damage 1d4 slashing

Str +2, Dex +3, Con +1, Int –4, Wis +2, Cha +0

Hit Points 4

Skill Stealth

Senses low-light vision

Speed 10 feet, fly 60 feet

Support Benefit The bird pecks at your foes' eyes when you create an opening. Until the start of your next turn, your Strikes that damage a creature that your bird threatens also deal 1d4 persistent bleed damage, and the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} until it removes the bleed damage. If your bird is nimble or savage, the persistent bleed damage increases to 2d4.

Advanced Maneuver @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-animal-companions.AC-Advanced-Maneuvers.Item.X4VjMfVVAjZjwcrT]{Flyby Attack}

Blood Wolf.name: Blood Wolf
Blood Wolf.description:
Your companion is a wolf, dog, or other canine.

Size Small

Melee 1 jaws (finesse), Damage 1d8 piercing

Str +2, Dex +3, Con +2, Int –4, Wis +1, Cha +0

Hit Points 6

Skill Intimidation

Senses darkvision, scent (imprecise, 30 feet)

Speed 40 feet

Support Benefit Your wolf tears tendons with each opening. Until the start of your next turn, your Strikes that damage creatures your wolf threatens give the target a –5-foot status penalty to its Speeds for 1 minute (–10 on a critical success).

Advanced Maneuver @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-animal-companions.AC-Advanced-Maneuvers.Item.xssFjTXqGlsaddvl]{Takedown}

Boar.name: Boar
Boar.description:
Your companion is a boar or pig.

Size Small

Melee 1 tusk, Damage 1d8 piercing

Str +3, Dex +1, Con +2, Int –4, Wis +2, Cha +0

Hit Points 8

Skill Survival

Senses low-light vision, scent (imprecise) 30 feet

Speed 35 feet

Support Benefit Your boar gores your foes. Until the start of your next turn, your Strikes that damage a creature in your boar's reach also deal 1d6 persistent bleed damage. If your boar is nimble or savage, the persistent bleed damage increases to 2d6.

Advanced Maneuver @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-animal-companions.AC-Advanced-Maneuvers.Item.EwCqdvU8WOw2SSxm]{Boar Charge}

Camel.name: Camel
Camel.description:
Your companion is a camel or llama.

Size Medium or Large

Melee 1 jaws, Damage 1d6 piercing

Str +3, Dex +2, Con +2, Int –4, Wis +1, Cha +0

Hit Points 8

Skill Survival

Senses low-light vision, scent (imprecise, 30 feet)

Speed 35 feet

Special mount; your camel ignores the harmful effects of mild, severe, and extreme cold or heat, selected when you gain the companion

Support Benefit The camel makes a ranged attack to spit a long string of saliva at a foe within 10 feet. On a hit, the foe is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} for 1 round.

Advanced Maneuver @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-animal-companions.AC-Advanced-Maneuvers.Item.PAXJgysWqv3T0tTD]{Sand Stride}

Capybara.name: Capybara
Capybara.description:
Your animal companion is a capybara, a giant rodent common in the forests of Arcadia.

Size Small

Melee 1 head (agile), Damage 1d6 bludgeoning

Str +2, Dex +2, Con +2, Int –4, Wis +2, Cha +0

Hit Points 6

Skill Survival

Senses low-light vision, scent (imprecise, 30 feet)

Speed 30 feet, swim 15 feet

Support Benefit Your capybara assists you in battle. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus on your next attack roll to Strike a foe within your capybara's reach. The bonus lasts until the first time you use it or until the beginning of your next turn, whichever comes first.

Advanced Maneuver @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-animal-companions.AC-Advanced-Maneuvers.Item.cpMkN79PdNci3nGp]{Distracting Spray}

Cat.name: Cat
Cat.description:
Your companion is a big cat, such as a leopard or tiger.

Size Small

Melee 1 jaws (finesse), Damage 1d6 piercing

Melee 1 claw (agile, finesse), Damage 1d4 slashing

Str +2, Dex +3, Con +1, Int –4, Wis +2, Cha +0

Hit Points 4

Skill Stealth

Senses low-light vision, scent (imprecise, 30 feet)

Speed 35 feet

Special Your cat deals 1d4 extra precision damage against @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} targets.

Support Benefit Your cat throws your enemies off-balance when you create an opening. Until the start of your next turn, your Strikes that deal damage to a creature within your cat's reach make the target off-guard until the end of your next turn.

Advanced Maneuver @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-animal-companions.AC-Advanced-Maneuvers.Item.U0J8J5ukmqnOskE8]{Cat Pounce}

Cave Gecko.name: Cave Gecko
Cave Gecko.description:
Your companion is a sticky-footed lizard like a gecko or anole.

Size Small

Melee 1 jaws (finesse), Damage 1d6 piercing

Str +2, Dex +3, Con +1, Int –4, Wis +2, Cha +0

Hit Points 6

Skill Stealth

Senses low-light vision, scent (imprecise) 30 feet

Speed 25 feet, climb 25 feet

Support Benefit Your cave gecko helps you stay afoot, leaning into you and propping you up as you maneuver your opponent. Until the end of your next turn, as long as you are adjacent to your cave gecko, if you attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.Dt6B1slsBy8ipJu9]{Disarm}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.7blmbDrQFNfdT731]{Shove}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.ge56Lu1xXVFYUnLP]{Trip} an opponent and roll a critical failure, you get a failure instead.

Advanced Maneuver @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-animal-companions.AC-Advanced-Maneuvers.Item.q0Vh2V6KlzdMi1Pv]{Tongue Pull}

Cave Pterosaur.name: Cave Pterosaur
Cave Pterosaur.description:
Your companion is a flying prehistoric creature, such as a dimorphodon or pterodactyl, that has adapted to life in the cavern vaults beneath the ground.

Size Small

Melee 1 beak (finesse), Damage 1d6 piercing

Melee 1 talon (agile, finesse), Damage 1d4 slashing

Str +2, Dex +3, Con +1, Int –4, Wis +2, Cha +0

Hit Points 4

Skill Thievery (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.ijZ0DDFpMkWqaShd]{Palm an Object} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.RDXXE7wMrSPCLv5k]{Steal} only)

Senses darkvision

Speed 10 feet, fly 60 feet

Support Benefit Your pterosaur expands its wings and makes distracting flapping motions. Any creature that would gain lesser cover from the pterosaur gains standard cover instead.

Advanced Maneuver @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-animal-companions.AC-Advanced-Maneuvers.Item.7C9iFWBpEOJs4Uo2]{Pterosaur Swoop}

Chetamog.name: Chetamog
Chetamog.description:
Your companion is a chetamog, a large tree-dwelling rodent that makes its home in the branches of the largest and most ancient trees of the Verduran Forest.

Size Medium or Large.

Melee 1 jaws, Damage 1d8 piercing

Melee 1 claw (agile), Damage 1d6 slashing

Str +1, Dex +3, Con +2, Int –4, Wis +1, Cha +0

Hit Points 8

Skill Survival

Senses low-light vision, scent (imprecise, 30 feet)

Speed 40 feet

Special mount

Support Benefit A chetamog ignores difficult terrain and greater difficult terrain from non-magical foliage.

Advanced Maneuver @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-animal-companions.AC-Advanced-Maneuvers.Item.AJ7hsZCvwLIzalYA]{Scurry}

Combat Squox.name: Combat Squox
Combat Squox.description:
Your companion is an augmented squox.

Size Small

Melee 1 jaws (agile, finesse), Damage 1d6 piercing

Str +2, Dex +3, Con +1, Int –4, Wis +2, Cha +0

Hit Points 6

Skill Stealth

Senses low-light vision, scent (imprecise, 30 feet)

Speed 25 feet, climb 25 feet

Support Benefit Your squox works with you to form an opening in combat. Until the start of your next turn, if your Strike damages a creature in your squox's reach, your squox can attempt to [[/act disarm]] the target using its Acrobatics instead of Athletics.

Advanced Maneuver @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-animal-companions.AC-Advanced-Maneuvers.Item.JdynMugT1PhHxhiK]{Go For the Eyes!}

Cragstone Bear.name: Cragstone Bear
Cragstone Bear.description:
Your companion is a four-legged cave ursine whose diet includes mineral-rich cave water that causes plates of rock to grow over its fur. Playful and energetic, the cragstone bear tends to have a personality more like a loyal dog than a grizzly, but with its rocky hide, its romping can be more forceful than intended.

Size Small

Melee 1 slam, Damage 1d8 bludgeoning

Melee 1 claw (agile), Damage 1d6 slashing

Str +3, Dex +1, Con +3, Int –4, Wis +1, Cha +0

Hit Points 8

Skill Survival

Senses darkvision, tremorsense (imprecise, 20 feet)

Speed 35 feet

Support Benefit Your cragstone bear eagerly defends you. Until the start of your next turn, you gain a +1 circumstance bonus to your AC if your cragstone bear is adjacent to you. If your bear is nimble or savage, increase the bonus to +2.

Advanced Maneuver @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-animal-companions.AC-Advanced-Maneuvers.Item.t78nd4y8L1G6yGTs]{Rolling Charge}

Crocodile.name: Crocodile
Crocodile.description:
Your companion is a crocodile or a similar crocodilian reptile, such as an alligator or caiman.

Size Small

Melee 1 jaws, Damage 1d8 piercing

Melee 1 tail (agile), Damage 1d6 bludgeoning

Str +3, Dex +2, Con +2, Int –4, Wis +1, Cha +0

Hit Points 6

Skill Stealth

Senses low-light vision

Speed 20 feet, swim 25 feet

Special The crocodile can hold its breath for about 2 hours.

Support Benefit Your crocodile clamps its jaws on your foe, refusing to let go. Until the start of your next turn, if your Strike damages a creature in your crocodile's reach, your crocodile can latch onto the creature. While thus attached, the crocodile can move along with the target whenever the target moves until the end of your next turn. Your crocodile can latch onto only one creature in this way, and it must release the creature to make a jaws Strike. If the target is smaller than the crocodile, it takes a –10-foot circumstance penalty to its Speeds and can't Fly while the crocodile is latched on.

Advanced Maneuver @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-animal-companions.AC-Advanced-Maneuvers.Item.ttJ1CanrAuehoSV8]{Death Roll}

Draft Lizard.name: Draft Lizard
Draft Lizard.description:
Your companion is a giant lizard, used in the depths of Highhelm as mounts and pack animals.

Size Medium

Melee 1 jaws, Damage 1d8 piecing

Melee 1 tail (finesse), Damage 1d6 bludgeoning

Str +3, Dex +2, Con +2, Int –4, Wis +1, Cha +0

Hit Points 8

Skill Athletics

Senses darkvision, scent (imprecise) 30 feet

Speed 25 feet

Special mount

Support Benefit Your draft lizard assists you in battle. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus on your next attack roll to Strike a foe within your draft lizard's reach. The bonus lasts until the first time you use it or until the beginning of your next turn, whichever comes first.

Advanced Maneuver @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-animal-companions.AC-Advanced-Maneuvers.Item.MNiXOHI1Ezh0D24r]{Tail Swipe}

Dromaeosaur.name: Dromaeosaur
Dromaeosaur.description:
Your companion is a dromaeosaur (also called a raptor), such as a velociraptor or deinonychus.

Size Small

Melee 1 jaws (finesse), Damage 1d8 piercing

Melee 1 talon (agile, finesse), Damage 1d6 slashing

Str +2, Dex +3, Con +2, Int –4, Wis +1, Cha +0

Hit Points 6

Skill Stealth

Senses low-light vision, scent (imprecise, 30 feet)

Speed 50 feet

Support Benefit Your raptor constantly darts into flanking position. Until the start of your next turn, it counts as being in its space or an empty space of your choice within 10 feet when determining whether you and your companion are flanking; you can choose a different space for each of your attacks.

Advanced Maneuver @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-animal-companions.AC-Advanced-Maneuvers.Item.ClUiCoBn3lHBBK5c]{Darting Attack}

Durian Crab.name: Durian Crab
Durian Crab.description:
In the southern provinces of Nagajor, Xa Hoi, throughout the archipelago of Minata, and hidden within the thick overgrowth of the Valashmai Jungle are the notorious killer crustaceans known only as durian crabs. Using their large, powerful claws, they scale the trunks of tall trees, hiding their presence away from even the most observant of prey. When the time is right, they fall, plummeting onto their prey and letting the momentum and prickly thorns of their shells earn them their quarry.

Size Small or Medium

Melee 1 claw (agile), Damage 1d6 piercing

Str +3, Dex +2, Con +1, Int –4, Wis +2, Cha +0

Hit Points 6

Skill Stealth

Senses darkvision

Speed 20 feet, climb 20 feet, swim 20 feet

Support Benefit Your durian crab launches itself as part of your ranged attack to throw your enemies off balance. Until the start of your next turn, as long as your crab is within your reach, your ranged Strikes that deal damage to a creature within 30 feet make the target @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} until the end of your next turn. Your crab scuttles or launches itself back to the same space from which you threw it immediately after making a Strike, allowing you to hurl it multiple times.

Advanced Maneuver @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-animal-companions.AC-Advanced-Maneuvers.Item.Di4yucWH3akIJXOr]{Crab Cannon}

Earth Elemental.name: Earth Elemental
Earth Elemental.description:
Your companion is an earth elemental, such as a living boulder or sod hound.

Access You are a member of the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.classfeatures.Item.fKTewWlYgFuhl4KA]{Stone Order}.

Size Small

Melee 1 fist, Damage 1d8 bludgeoning

Str +2, Dex +0, Con +3, Int –4, Wis +1, Cha +0

Hit Points 10

Skill Survival

Senses darkvision

Speed 20 feet, burrow 10 feet

Support Benefit Your earth elemental cracks the earth beneath your foe's feet, making it difficult for the foe to move. Until the start of your next turn, if you hit with a Strike and deal damage to a creature in your earth elemental's reach, the first square the creature moves into after taking that damage is difficult terrain.

Advanced Maneuver @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-animal-companions.AC-Advanced-Maneuvers.Item.W6zkL0y4MqvlR0yW]{Rolling Knockdown}

Elephant.name: Elephant
Elephant.description:
Your companion is an elephant or mammoth.

Size Large

Melee 1 tusk, Damage 1d8 piercing

Melee 1 foot, Damage 1d6 bludgeoning

Str +3, Dex +1, Con +2, Int –4, Wis +2, Cha +0

Hit Points 8

Skill Intimidation

Senses low-light vision, scent (imprecise, 30 feet)

Speed 35 feet

Special mount

Support Benefit Your elephant trumpets noisily and menaces your enemy. The first creature within your elephant's reach that you hit and deal damage to before the start of your next turn has difficulty hearing as its ears ring from the noise, taking a –4 status penalty to purely auditory Perception checks until the end of your next turn.

Advanced Maneuver @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-animal-companions.AC-Advanced-Maneuvers.Item.oYEXImMSzg0eDqzR]{Grabbing Trunk}

Elk.name: Elch
Elk.description:
Dein Gefährte ist ein Elch oder ähnlicher Angehöriger der Hirsche, z.B. ein Karibu, ein großes Reh oder ein Wapiti.

Größenkategorie Mittelgroß oder Groß

Nahkampf 1 Geweih, Schaden 1W8 Stichschaden

Nahkampf 1 Huf (Agil), Schaden 1W6 Wuchtschaden

ST +3, GE +2, KO +2, IN –4, WE +1, CH +0

Trefferpunkte 8

Fertigkeit Einschüchtern

Sinne Dämmersicht

Bewegungsrate 30 Fuß/9 m

Speziell @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.PM5jvValFkbFH3TV]{Reittier}

Unterstützungsvorteil Dein Elch macht Drohgebärden mit seinem Geweih. Bis zum Beginn deines nächsten Zuges erhält jede Kreatur innerhalb des Angriffsradius deines Elchs den Zustand @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Verängstigt 1}, wenn du sie triffst und ihr Schaden zufügst.

Verbessertes Manöver @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-animal-companions.AC-Advanced-Maneuvers.Item.gFZCyLnqeWrK6u0P]{Geweihkatapult}

Fiery Leopard.name: Fiery Leopard
Fiery Leopard.description:
Your companion is a big cat, such as a leopard or tiger.

Size Small

Melee 1 jaws (finesse), Damage 1d6 piercing

Melee 1 claw (agile, finesse), Damage 1d4 slashing

Str +2, Dex +3, Con +1, Int –4, Wis +2, Cha +0

Hit Points 4

Skill Stealth

Senses low-light vision, scent (imprecise, 30 feet)

Speed 35 feet

Special Your cat deals 1d4 extra precision damage against @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} targets.

Support Benefit Your cat throws your enemies off-balance when you create an opening. Until the start of your next turn, your Strikes that deal damage to a creature within your cat's reach make the target off-guard until the end of your next turn.

Advanced Maneuver @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-animal-companions.AC-Advanced-Maneuvers.Item.U0J8J5ukmqnOskE8]{Cat Pounce}

Immunities fire

Weaknesses cold 5

Flaming Attacks (fire) The fiery leopard's natural attacks deal 1 fire damage (in addition to the bonus damage dealt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg] targets). This damage increases to 1d4 when the fiery leopard becomes a nimble or savage animal companion.

Fiery Pelt (fire) Creatures that start their turn grappled by the fiery leopard take @Damage[1d4[fire]] damage. Anyone attempting to grapple the fiery leopard takes @Damage[1d4[fire]] damage for each attempt.

Burning Glow The fiery leopard sheds dim light in a 10-foot radius which gives it a –2 circumstance penalty on Stealth checks made at night or in a dark environment.

Fire Elemental.name: Fire Elemental
Fire Elemental.description:
Your companion is a fire elemental, such as a cinder rat or lava otter.

Access You are a member of the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.classfeatures.Item.NdeFvIXdHwKYLiUj]{Flame Order}.

Size Small

Melee 1 tendril (agile, finesse), Damage 1d6 fire

Str +2, Dex +2, Con +1, Int –4, Wis +1, Cha +0

Hit Points 4

Skill Intimidation

Senses darkvision

Speed 25 feet

Special Immunities fire, Weaknesses cold and water (equal to the fire elemental's level)

Support Benefit Your fire elemental burns your foes and sets them on fire. Until the start of your next turn, your Strikes that damage a creature in your fire elemental's reach also deal 1d6 persistent fire damage. If your fire elemental is nimble or savage, the persistent fire damage increases to 2d6.

Advanced Maneuver @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-animal-companions.AC-Advanced-Maneuvers.Item.LCilgiiIZp408R3k]{Flamethrower}

Flying Squirrel.name: Flughörnchen
Flying Squirrel.description:
Dein Gefährte ist ein Riesenflughörnchen oder -zuckergleiter.

Größenkategorie Klein

Nahkampf 1 Biss (Finesse), Schaden 1W6 Stichschaden

Nahkampf 1 Klaue (Agil, Finesse), Schaden 1W4 Hiebschaden

ST +2, GE +3, KO +1, IN –4, WE +2, CH +0

Trefferpunkte 6

Fertigkeit Heimlichkeit

Sinne Dämmersicht, Geruchssinn (ungenau) 30 Fuß/9 m

Bewegungsrate 25 Fuß/7,50 m, Klettern 25 Fuß/7,50 m

Speziell Wenn dein Flughörnchen stürzt, stürzt es nur 5 Fuß/1,50 m weit zu Beginn deines Zuges und bewegt sich dann bis zu 25 Fuß/7,50 m horizontal. Sollte es nicht handeln können, kann es auch nicht gleiten.

Unterstützungsvorteil Dein Flughörnchen wickelt seine Flughäute um deine Gegner und behindert ihre Bewegungen. Bis zum Ende deines nächsten Zuges erhält eine Kreatur 1 Runde lang einen Situationsmalus von -10 Fuß/3 m auf ihre Bewegungsraten, sofern du ihr mit deinem Angriff Schaden zufügst und sie sich dabei im Angriffsradius deines Flughörnchens befunden hat.

Verbessertes Manöver @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-animal-companions.AC-Advanced-Maneuvers.Item.OYzEhVH6zMgf64Tg]{Tod von oben}

Ghost.name: Ghost
Ghost.description:
Your companion is a ghost, bound to an item in your possession. Due to this bond, your ghost companion can move beyond the area of a single dwelling, but it's easier to disrupt than most incorporeal creatures. A ghost companion can be formed from a humanoid, animal, or other creature. The ghost isn't sapient and is unable to speak with the living.

Size Small or Medium

Melee 1 ghostly touch (finesse, magical), Damage 1d8 negative (doesn't apply the ghost's Strength modifier)

Str –5, Dex +3, Con +0, Int –4, Wis +1, Cha +2

Hit Points 4

Skill Stealth

Senses darkvision

Speed fly 20 feet

Special @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-animal-companions.AC-Features.Item.BjE6osOFlAishRbh]{Anchored Incorporeality}

Support Benefit Your ghost spooks and scares your foes as you attack them. Until the start of your next turn, if you hit and deal damage to a creature in your ghost's reach, the creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.

Advanced Maneuver @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-animal-companions.AC-Advanced-Maneuvers.Item.NMaMTiDB40L5O41S]{Telekinetic Assault}

Giant Eel.name: Riesenaal
Giant Eel.description:
Dein Gefährte ist ein langer, bandartiger Fisch mit kantigen Zähnen.

Zugang Abstammung Athamaru

Größenkategorie Groß

Nahkampf 1 Biss, Schaden 1W8 Stichschaden

ST +3, GE +1, KO +2, IN –4, WE +2, CH +0

Trefferpunkte 4

Fertigkeit Heimlichkeit

Sinne Dämmersicht, Geruchssinn (ungenau, 30 Fuß/9 m)

Bewegungsrate 10 Fuß/3 m, Schwimmen 40 Fuß/12 m

Speziell @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.PM5jvValFkbFH3TV]{Reittier}

Unterstützungsvorteil Dein Riesenaal schwimmt in verwirrendem Zickzack. Bis zum Beginn deines nächsten Zuges zählt er als in seinem Feld oder einem leeren Feld deiner Wahl innerhalb von 10 Fuß/3 m Entfernung befindlich hinsichtlich der Frage, ob ihr zusammen einen Gegner flankiert. Du kannst bei jedem deiner Angriffe ein anderes Feld wählen.

Verbessertes Manöver @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-animal-companions.AC-Advanced-Maneuvers.Item.IOD6OoDYcncviidf]{Zubeißen im Vorbeischwimmen}

Giant Frog.name: Riesenfrosch
Giant Frog.description:
Dein Gefährte ist ein großer Frosch oder eine große Kröte.

Größenkategorie Groß

Nahkampf 1 Biss, Schaden 1W8 Stichschaden

Nahkampf 1 Zunge (Angriffsradius 4,50 m), Schaden 1W4 Wuchtschaden

ST +2, GE +2, KO +3, IN –4, WE +1, CH +0

Trefferpunkte 6

Fertigkeit Überlebenskunde

Sinne Dämmersicht

Bewegungsrate 20 Fuß/6 m, Klettern 20 Fuß/6 m, Schwimmen 25 Fuß/7,50 m

Speziell @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.PM5jvValFkbFH3TV]{Reittier}

Unterstützungsvorteil Die klebrige Zunge deines Riesenfrosches schießt vor, wenn dein Gegner irgendwo seine Deckung vernachlässigt, und stört seine Bewegungen. Bis zum Beginn deines nächsten Zuges kann eine Kreatur keine durch deine Handlungen ausgelösten Reaktionen nutzen, sofern du ihn erfolgreich angreifst, während er durch deinen Riesenfrosch bedroht wird, außer seine Stufe ist höher als die deine.

Verbessertes Manöver @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-animal-companions.AC-Advanced-Maneuvers.Item.X1UE76uHDTcXf9ZW]{Greifende Zunge}

Giant Rock Tuatara.name: Giant Rock Tuatara
Giant Rock Tuatara.description:
Your companion is a much larger cousin of the common rock tuatara, up to 6 feet long and 4 feet tall. Their milky-white third eye, spiny backs, and knobby club tails make them look far fiercer than they typically are.

Size Medium

Melee 1 tail slam, Damage 1d8 bludgeoning

Melee 1 bite, Damage 1d6 piercing

Str +3, Dex +2, Con +2, Int –4, Wis +1, Cha +0

Hit Points 8

Skill Intimidation

Senses darkvision, scent (imprecise, 30 feet)

Speed 25 feet

Support Benefit Your giant rock tuatara trips up your enemies when you create an opening. Until the start of your next turn, your Strikes that deal damage to a creature within your giant rock tuatara's reach make the target @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} until the end of your next turn.

Advanced Maneuver @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-animal-companions.AC-Advanced-Maneuvers.Item.EFIHKMpb0EobvM5S]{Tail Escape}

Giant Wasp.name: Riesenwespe
Giant Wasp.description:
Dein Gefährte ist eine große Wespe, eine große Hornisse oder ein anderer stechender Hautflügler.

Größenkategorie Groß

Nahkampf 1 Stachel (Finesse), Schaden 1W6 Stichschaden plus Gift

ST +2, GE +3, KO +2, IN –4, WE +1, CH +0

Trefferpunkte 4

Fertigkeit Überlebenskunde

Sinne Dunkelsicht

Bewegungsrate 20 Fuß/6 m, Fliegen 40 Fuß/12 m

Speziell @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.PM5jvValFkbFH3TV]{Reittier}

Unterstützungsvorteil Deine Wespe erzeugt mit ihren Flügeln ein dröhnendes Summen, welches deine Gegner entnervt. Bis zum Beginn deines nächsten Zuges erhält eine Gegner im Angriffsradius deiner Riesenwespe den Zustand @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Verängstigt 1}, sofern du sie triffst und ihr Schaden zufügst.

Verbessertes Manöver @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-animal-companions.AC-Advanced-Maneuvers.Item.5ux66ubWlevY7z2K]{Zustechen und Fortfliegen}

Gibtas.name: Gibtas
Gibtas.description:
Your companion is a gibtas.

Size Small

Melee 1 jaws, Damage 1d8 piercing

Melee 1 claw (agile), Damage 1d6 slashing

Str +3, Dex +2, Con +2, Int -4, Wis +1, Cha +0

Hit Points 8

Skill Intimidation

Senses low-light vision, scent (imprecise, 30 feet)

Speed 35 feet

Support Benefit Your gibtas mauls your enemies when you create an opening. Until the start of your next turn, each time you hit a creature in the gibtas' reach with a Strike, the creature takes 1d8 slashing damage from the gibtas. If your gibtas is nimble or savage, the slashing damage increases to 2d8.

Advanced Maneuver @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-animal-companions.AC-Advanced-Maneuvers.Item.Uv49tQCwUUjaMCj5]{Bouncing Slam}

Giraffe.name: Giraffe
Giraffe.description:
Dein Gefährte ist eine Giraffe.

Größenkategorie Groß

Nahkampf 1 Huf (Agil), Schaden 1W6 Wuchtschaden

Nahkampf 1 Hals (Angriffsradius 3 m, Nichttödlich), Schaden 1W4 Wuchtschaden

ST +3, GE +2, KO +2, IN –4, WE +1, CH +0

Trefferpunkte 8

Fertigkeit Einschüchtern

Sinne Dämmersicht, Geruchssinn (ungenau, 30 Fuß/9 m)

Bewegungsrate 35 Fuß/10,50 m

Speziell @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.PM5jvValFkbFH3TV]{Reittier}

Unterstützungsvorteil Deine Giraffe schiebt Gegner mit ihrem langen Hals voran. Während du auf deiner Giraffe reitest, benötigst du keine freie Hand im gleichen Zug, um einen Gegner @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.7blmbDrQFNfdT731]{Fortzustoßen}; jeder erfolgreich gestoßene Gegner bewegt sich 10 Fuß/3 m weit (bzw. 4,50 m bei einem Kritischen Erfolg).

Verbessertes Manöver @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-animal-companions.AC-Advanced-Maneuvers.Item.9IqqECMTmfbaBY0C]{Ausholender Tritt}

Goat.name: Goat
Goat.description:
Your companion is a breed of mountain goat populous in the Five Kings Mountains.

Size Medium

Melee 1 headbutt (shove), Damage 1d8 bludgeoning

Str +3, Dex +2, Con +2, Int –4, Wis +1, Cha +0

Hit Points 8

Skill Acrobatics

Senses scent (imprecise) 30 feet

Speed 35 feet, climb 15 feet

Special mount

Support Benefit Your goat boosts you up a wall, allowing you to reach greater heights. You climb up a surface as if you had rolled a success on a Climb action.

Advanced Maneuver @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-animal-companions.AC-Advanced-Maneuvers.Item.IoWvKP6WDijlkrin]{Knock Aside}

Gray Bladeling.name: Gray Bladeling
Gray Bladeling.description:
Access You're from Galt.

Your companion is a vaguely humanoid construct composed of razor-sharp blades and animated by an amalgamation of restless soul fragments, similar to a miniature gray death. Although it possesses no identity or memories from the souls it contains, it's driven by a powerful but unfocused hate that its master must sometimes struggle to control.

Size Small

Melee 1 blade (agile, finesse), Damage 1d8 slashing

Str +2, Dex +1, Con +2, Int –4, Wis +0, Cha +1

Hit Points 10 (void healing)

Skill Athletics

Senses darkvision, lifesense (imprecise) 30 feet

Speed 20 feet

Special A gray bladeling has the construct and undead traits instead of the animal trait. It has immunity to bleed, death effects, disease, doomed, drained, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued}, healing, nonlethal attacks, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}, poison, and sickened. Unlike most undead, it becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} and dying rather than being destroyed instantly at 0 Hit Points; unlike most constructs, its Hit Points can be restored by only void healing instead of any other actions that restore Hit Points to objects or nonliving creatures.

Support Benefit The gray bladeling slashes viciously at your enemy when you create an opening. Until the start of your next turn, each time you hit a creature in the bladeling's reach with a Strike, the creature takes 1d4 persistent bleed damage or becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1} if it's already taking persistent bleed damage. If the gray bladeling is specialized, the persistent bleed damage increases to 1d8.

Advanced Maneuver @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-animal-companions.AC-Advanced-Maneuvers.Item.7q2MhobheQtrYDDw]{Possessing Strike}

Griffon.name: Greif
Griffon.description:
Dein Gefährte ist eine majestätische Bestie, welche die Merkmale eines Raubvogels und eines Löwen verbindet.

Größenkategorie Groß

Nahkampf 1 Schnabel, Schaden 1W8 Stichschaden

Nahkampf 1 Kralle (Agil), Schaden 1W6 Hiebschaden

ST +3, GE +2, KO +2, IN –4, WE +1, CH +0

Trefferpunkte 8

Fertigkeit Überlebenskunde

Sinne Dunkelsicht, Geruchssinn (ungenau, 30 Fuß/9 m)

Bewegungsrate 25 Fuß/7,50 m, Fliegen 60 Fuß/18 m

Speziell @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.PM5jvValFkbFH3TV]{Reittier}

Unterstützungsvorteil Dein Greif nimmt eine noble Haltung an und inspiriert dich, dich den Schrecken um dich herum zu widersetzen. Bis zum Beginn deines nächsten Zuges erhalten du und dein Greif einen Situationsbonus von +2 auf Würfe gegen Effekte der Kategorie Gefühl.

Verbessertes Manöver @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-animal-companions.AC-Advanced-Maneuvers.Item.WocN44CJGHYxitzM]{Krallenangriff im Vorbeiflug}

Hermit Krait.name: Hermit Krait
Hermit Krait.description:
There are countless tales of young children wallowing in the shallow waters, pressing the mouth of a seemingly empty shell to their ears, hoping to hear roaring waves, only to be met with a reptilian hiss and the bite of two fangs. There's more than meets the eye when it comes to hermit kraits, in multiple ways. On the surface, the creature seems like a mundane shell taken over by a den of snakes, but any attempt to pry it from its home will only kill it, revealing a strange, reptilian creature with a multitude of heads.

Size Small

Melee 1 fangs (agile, finesse), Damage 1d6 piercing

Str +2, Dex +3, Con +2, Int –4, Wis +1, Cha +0

Hit Points 6

Skill Stealth

Senses low-light vision, scent (imprecise, 30 feet)

Speed 20 feet, burrow 15 feet, swim 20 feet

Support Benefit Your hermit krait bites at your foes with venomous fangs. Until the start of your next turn, your Strikes that damage a creature in your hermit krait's reach also deal 1d6 persistent poison damage. If your hermit krait is nimble or savage, the persistent poison damage increases to 2d6.

Advanced Maneuver @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-animal-companions.AC-Advanced-Maneuvers.Item.wQewsJLOsfucMXyB]{Defensive Curl}

Hippocampus.name: Seepferd
Hippocampus.description:
Dein Gefährte ist eine fremdartige Bestie, die Aspekt von Pferd und Fisch kombiniert.

Größenkategorie Groß

Nahkampf 1 Schwanz, Schaden 1W6 Wuchtschaden

ST +3, GE +1, KO +3, IN –4, WE +1, CH +0

Trefferpunkte 6

Fertigkeit Überlebenskunde

Sinne Dunkelsicht, Geruchssinn (ungenau) 30 Fuß/9 m

Bewegungsrate 5 Fuß/1,50 m, Schwimmen 40 Fuß/12 m

Speziell @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.PM5jvValFkbFH3TV]{Reittier}

Unterstützungsvorteil Bis zum Beginn deines nächsten Zuges fügst du dem Schaden deines Nahkampfangriffes einen Situationsbonus in Höhe der doppelten Anzahl der Schadenswürfel hinzu, sofern du vor dem fraglichen Angriff auf deinem Seepferd reitend wenigstens 10 Fuß/3 m zurücklegst. Sollte deine Waffe über die Waffenkategorie Reiter verfügen, so erhöhe stattdessen den aus dieser Kategorie resultierenden Schaden um 2 pro Würfel.

Verbessertes Manöver @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-animal-companions.AC-Advanced-Maneuvers.Item.R2RNXJH06UhSMmzp]{Plötzlicher Rückzug}

Hippogriff.name: Pferdegreif
Hippogriff.description:
Dein Gefährte verbindet die Merkmale eines Adlers mit denen eines Pferdes.

Größenkategorie Groß

Nahkampf 1 Schnabel, Schaden 1W6 Stichschaden

Nahkampf 1 Kralle (Agil), Schaden 1W4 Hiebschaden

ST +2, GE +2, KO +2, IN –4, WE +2, CH +0

Trefferpunkte 8

Fertigkeit Überlebenskunde

Sinne Dunkelsicht, Geruchssinn (ungenau, 30 Fuß/9 m)

Bewegungsrate 30 Fuß/9 m, Fliegen 60 Fuß/18 m

Speziell @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.PM5jvValFkbFH3TV]{Reittier}

Unterstützungsvorteil Sofern du auf deinem Pferdegreif reitest und dich vor einem Nahkampfangriff wenigstens 10 Fuß/3 m weit bewegt hast, so addiere bis zum Beginn deines nächsten Zuges einen Situationsbonus auf den Schaden dieses Angriffes in Höhe der doppelten Anzahl der Waffenschadenswürfel. Sollte deine Waffe über die Waffenkategorie Reiter verfügen, so erhöhe stattdessen den aus dieser Kategorie resultierenden Schaden um 2 pro Würfel.

Verbessertes Manöver @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-animal-companions.AC-Advanced-Maneuvers.Item.SkVl3yomdYZoS7Hx]{Fliegender Rückzug}

Horse.name: Horse
Horse.description:
Your companion is a horse, pony, or similar equine.

Size Medium or Large

Melee 1 hoof (agile), Damage 1d6 bludgeoning

Str +3, Dex +2, Con +2, Int –4, Wis +1, Cha +0

Hit Points 8

Skill Survival

Senses low-light vision, scent (imprecise, 30 feet)

Speed 40 feet

Special mount

Support Benefit Until the start of your next turn, if you're mounted on your horse and moved 10 feet or more on the action before a melee Strike, add a circumstance bonus to damage for that Strike equal to twice the number of weapon damage dice. If your weapon already has the jousting weapon trait, increase the trait's damage bonus by 2 per die instead.

Advanced Maneuver @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-animal-companions.AC-Advanced-Maneuvers.Item.tsOaXTRWQvsKTyaL]{Gallop}

Hyena.name: Hyena
Hyena.description:
Your companion is a hyena

Size Small

Melee 1 jaws (finesse), Damage 1d8 piercing

Str +2, Dex +3, Con +2, Int –4, Wis +1, Cha +0

Hit Points 6

Skill Intimidation

Senses low-light vision, scent (imprecise, 30 feet)

Speed 40 feet

Support Benefit The hyena mockingly yowls at your enemies and bites at them when you create an opening. Until the start of your next turn, each time you hit a creature in the hyena's reach with a Strike, the creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.

Advanced Maneuver @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-animal-companions.AC-Advanced-Maneuvers.Item.oisXYTTYE0TABboA]{Gnaw}

Kangaroo.name: Kangaroo
Kangaroo.description:
Your companion is a kangaroo or wallaby.

Size Small

Melee 1 foot (agile), Damage 1d6 bludgeoning

Str +3, Dex +2, Con +2, Int –4, Wis +1, Cha +0

Hit Points 6

Skill Survival

Senses low-light vision

Speed 30 feet

Special When the kangaroo Leaps horizontally, it travels up to 25 feet.

Support Benefit Your kangaroo bounces and shifts back and forth. Until the start of your next turn, it counts as being in its space or an empty space of your choice within 5 feet when determining whether you and your companion are flanking; you can choose a different space for each of your attacks.

Advanced Maneuver @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-animal-companions.AC-Advanced-Maneuvers.Item.hjYmAzurrzcGyds4]{Spring Kick}

Keulia.name: Keulia
Keulia.description:
Your companion is a horned frilled lizard with a unique debris "shell" that can consist of precious metals and gems.

Size Small

Melee 1 jaws, Damage 1d6 piercing

Str +2, Dex +2, Con +3, Int –4, Wis +1, Cha +0

Hit Points 4

Skill Thievery

Senses low-light vision

Speed 30 feet, burrow 10 feet

Support Benefit With its hard shell of objects, your keulia rams into enemies when you create an opening. Until the start of your next turn, each time you hit a creature in your keulia's reach with a Strike and deal physical damage, the creatures takes 1d8 bludgeoning damage from the keulia. If your keulia is nimble or savage, the bludgeoning damage increases to 2d8.

Advanced Maneuver @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-animal-companions.AC-Advanced-Maneuvers.Item.FIwCYZyHgCmp8DeX]{Lizard Leap}

Legchair.name: Legchair
Legchair.description:
Your companion is a strange creature, akin to a chair with bestial legs.

Size Medium or Large

Melee 1 hoof (agile), Damage 1d6 bludgeoning

Str +3, Dex +2, Con +2, Int –4, Wis +1, Cha +0

Hit Points 8

Skill Stealth

Senses low-light vision, scent (imprecise, 30 feet)

Speed 40 feet

Special mount

Support Benefit Your legchair moves its limbs in the way of enemy attacks. You gain lesser cover from your legchair against all attacks, not just ones where the legchair would be in the way.

Advanced Maneuver @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-animal-companions.AC-Advanced-Maneuvers.Item.lrchn6ROZcuKCg3C]{Careful Withdraw}

Metal Elemental.name: Metal Elemental
Metal Elemental.description:
Your companion is a metal elemental, such as a mercurial. Metal elementals don't have any special access because druids don't have an order dedicated to the elemental magic of metal.

Size Small

Melee 1 spike, Damage 1d8 piercing

Str +2, Dex +1, Con +2, Int –4, Wis +1, Cha +0

Hit Points 8

Skill Intimidation

Senses darkvision

Speed 25 feet

Support Benefit Your metal elemental pierces an enemy with metal spikes that cause it to bleed. Until the start of your next turn, your Strikes that damage a creature in your metal elemental's reach also deal 1d6 persistent bleed damage. If your metal elemental is nimble or savage, the persistent bleed damage increases to 2d6.

Advanced Maneuver @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-animal-companions.AC-Advanced-Maneuvers.Item.oyNZpuQ6EU3prvo2]{Spiked Bunker}

Mole.name: Maulwurf
Mole.description:
Dein Gefährte ist ein Riesenmaulwurf, ein Erdhörnchen oder ein Präriehund.

Größenkategorie Klein

Nahkampf 1 Biss, Schaden 1W8 Stichschaden

Nahkampf 1 Klaue (Agil), Schaden 1W6 Hiebschaden

ST +3, GE +2, KO +2, IN –4, WE +1, CH +0

Trefferpunkte 8

Fertigkeit Heimlichkeit

Sinne Dämmersicht, Geruchssinn (ungenau, 30 Fuß/9 m)

Bewegungsrate 25 Fuß/7,50 m, Graben 20 Fuß/6 m

Unterstützungsvorteil Dein Maulwurf springt in den Boden, gräbt sich unter deinen Gegner hindurch und stört so ihr Gleichgewicht. Bis zum Ende deines nächsten Zuges, erhält jede Kreatur, die zu deinem Maulwurf angrenzend ist und von einem deiner Angriffe getroffen wird und dadurch Schaden erleidet, den Zustand @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Unbeholfen 1}, sofern es seine Position nicht früher verlässt.

Verbessertes Manöver @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-animal-companions.AC-Advanced-Maneuvers.Item.PZAHlaN4aG6NkSjj]{Grabender Hinterhalt}

Mongoose.name: Mungo
Mongoose.description:
Dein Gefährte ist ein Mungo oder eine Meerkatze.

Größenkategorie Klein

Nahkampf 1 Biss (Finesse), Schaden 1W6 Stichschaden

Nahkampf 1 Klaue (Agil, Finesse), Schaden 1W4 Hiebschaden

ST +2, GE +3, KO +1, IN –4, WE +1, CH +1

Trefferpunkte 4

Fertigkeit Überlebenskunde

Sinne Dämmersicht, Geruchssinn (ungenau, 30 Fuß/9 m)

Bewegungsrate 25 Fuß/7,50 m, Graben 10 Fuß/3 m

Unterstützungsvorteil Der Mungo springt wachsam und bereit an deine Seite. Bis zum Ende deines nächsten Zuges können zum Mungo angrenzende Kreaturen dich nicht flankieren.

Verbessertes Manöver @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-animal-companions.AC-Advanced-Maneuvers.Item.LBPGvjR3zSau0QC4]{Befreiender Biss}

Monitor Lizard.name: Monitor Lizard
Monitor Lizard.description:
Your companion is a stocky-limbed lizard with a long, almost serpentine body.

Size Medium

Melee 1 jaws, Damage 1d8 piercing

Str +3, Dex +2, Con +2, Int –4, Wis +1, Cha +0

Hit Points 8

Skill Survival

Senses low-light vision, scent (imprecise) 30 feet

Speed 30 feet

Special mount

Support Benefit The monitor lizard distracts an adjacent opponent with snapping jaws and rapid movements. Until the start of your next turn, if your Strike damages a foe, any time the foe attempts an action with the manipulate trait until the end of your next turn, it must attempt a @Check[flat|dc:5|showDC:all]. On a failure, the action is disrupted.

Advanced Maneuver @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-animal-companions.AC-Advanced-Maneuvers.Item.uR3j6TAJFeOVUHpY]{Lurching Rush}

Moth.name: Moth
Moth.description:
Your animal companion is a giant fruit-eating moth with a strong proboscis that can pierce skin.

Size Small

Melee 1 proboscis (finesse), Damage 1d6 piercing

Str +2, Dex +3, Con +1, Int -4, Wis +2, Cha +0

Hit Points 6

Skill Stealth

Senses darkvision, scent (imprecise, 30 feet)

Speed 15 feet, fly 30 feet

Special Your moth is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{Invisible} to echolocation.

Support Benefit Your moth releases a shower of dust to reveal your foes. Until the start of your next turn, if you damage a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden} creature in your moth's reach with a Strike, that creature requires only a DC 3 flat check to target it if it's concealed, or DC 9 if it's hidden. The reduced DC lasts until the end of your next turn.

Advanced Maneuver @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-animal-companions.AC-Advanced-Maneuvers.Item.WdTzlCO2i4loeYkQ]{Ultrasonic Scream}

Oozeform Chair.name: Oozeform Chair
Oozeform Chair.description:
Your companion is an alchemical ooze that extends pseudopods to move around.

Size Medium or Large

Melee 1 pseudopod (agile), Damage 1d6 bludgeoning

Str +3, Dex +2, Con +3, Int –4, Wis +0, Cha +0

Hit Points 6

Skill Athletics

Motion Sense Your oozeform chair can sense nearby creatures through vibration in the air. This is an imprecise sense with a range of 30 feet.

Speed 20 feet

Special mount

Support Benefit A pseudopod extends out from your chair, retrieving an unattended object within 15 feet. If you don't have a hand free to receive the object, the chair drops it in your space.

Advanced Maneuver @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-animal-companions.AC-Advanced-Maneuvers.Item.gzefJocgdWbXWWPi]{Extend Pseudopod}

Orca.name: Orca
Orca.description:
Dein Gefährte ist ein Killerwal.

Größenkategorie Groß

Nahkampf 1 Biss, Schaden 1W8 Stichschaden

ST +3, GE +2, KO +3, IN –4, WE +0, CH +0

Trefferpunkte 8

Fertigkeit Überlebenskunde

Sinne Echoortung 30 Fuß/9 m (der Orca kann sein Gehör als genauen Sinn mit dieser Reichweite nutzen, während er unter Wasser ist)

Bewegungsrate 5 Fuß/1,50 m, Schwimmen 40 Fuß/12 m

Speziell @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.PM5jvValFkbFH3TV]{Reittier}; der Orca kann 20 Minuten lang die Luft anhalten.

Unterstützungsvorteil Dein Orca versucht achtlose Schwimmer herabzuziehen. Bis zum Beginn deines nächsten Zuges wird jede von dir innerhalb des Angriffsradius des Orcas getroffene Kreatur um 5 Fuß/1,50 m ins Wasser hinabgezogen. Dies ist eine erzwungene Bewegung.

Verbessertes Manöver @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-animal-companions.AC-Advanced-Maneuvers.Item.HY6rzDpBJ4L5OmgI]{Aus dem Wasser schnellen}

Pangolin.name: Pangolin
Pangolin.description:
Your companion is a particularly large pangolin, such as an ugvashi from Vudra.

Size Medium

Melee 1 body, Damage 1d8 bludgeoning

Melee 1 claw (agile), Damage 1d6 slashing

Str +3, Dex +2, Con +2, Int –4, Wis +1, Cha +0

Hit Points 8

Skill Survival

Senses low-light vision

Speed 25 feet

Support Benefit Your pangolin tears at your enemies with its serrated plates. Until the start of your next turn, your Strikes that damage a creature in your pangolin's reach also deal 1d6 persistent bleed damage. If your pangolin is nimble or savage, the persistent bleed damage increases to 2d6.

Advanced Maneuver @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-animal-companions.AC-Advanced-Maneuvers.Item.pMPtswKNokDNyYR2]{Defensive Curl}

Ravenous Drake.name: Ravenous Drake
Ravenous Drake.description:
As an animal companion, a ravenous drake is a small, flightless, and constantly hungry. A ravenous drake has the dragon trait instead of the animal trait, but it otherwise functions normally as an animal companion.

Melee 1 jaws, Damage 1d6 piercing

Str +3, Dex +1, Con +2, Int –3, Wis +1, Cha +0

Hit Points 8

Skill Athletics

Senses darkvision

Speed 25 feet, climb 20 feet

Support Benefit Your ravenous drake constantly tries to pull your foe or their possessions into its waiting jaws. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to any Athletics check to [[/act disarm]], [[/act reposition]], [[/act shove]], or [[/act trip]] an opponent adjacent to your ravenous drake.

Advanced Maneuver @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-animal-companions.AC-Advanced-Maneuvers.Item.j0p3u6ZSZliS20qF]{Suction Vortex}

Rhinoceros.name: Rhinoceros
Rhinoceros.description:
Your companion is a rhinoceros or woolly rhinoceros.

Size Large

Melee 1 horn, Damage 1d8 piercing

Str +3, Dex +1, Con +3, Int -4, Wis +1, Cha +0

Hit Points 8

Skill Survival

Senses scent (imprecise, 30 feet)

Speed 30 feet

Special mount

Support Benefit Your rhino swings its heavy head to unbalance your enemy. The first creature within your rhino's reach that you hit and deal damage to before the start of your next turn becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} until the end of your next turn.

Advanced Maneuver @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-animal-companions.AC-Advanced-Maneuvers.Item.JMHoCFb886K6dT1n]{Rhinoceros Charge}

Riding Drake.name: Riding Drake
Riding Drake.description:
Your companion is a swift, flightless drake with limited intelligence, less vicious than most drakes but fiercely loyal to you. A riding drake has the dragon trait instead of the animal trait, but it otherwise functions normally as an animal companion.

Size Large

Melee 1 jaws, Damage 1d8 piercing

Melee 1 tail, Damage 1d6 bludgeoning

Str +2, Dex +1, Con +2, Int –4, Wis +1, Cha +2

Hit Points 8

Skill Intimidation

Senses darkvision

Speed 45 feet

Special mount

Support Benefit Your drake snorts fire in your foes' faces. Until the start of your next turn, each time you Strike while riding the drake and hit a creature in the drake's reach, the creature takes 1d4 fire damage from the drake. If your drake is nimble or savage, the fire damage increases to 2d4.

Advanced Maneuver @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-animal-companions.AC-Advanced-Maneuvers.Item.8JdETVTpbZAgtBA3]{Fire Breath}

Riding Tarantula.name: Reittarantel
Riding Tarantula.description:
Dein Gefährte ist eine massive, haarige Spinne.

Größenkategorie Groß

Nahkampf 1 Biss (Finesse), Schaden 1W6 Stichschaden plus Gift

Nahkampf 1 Bein (Agil, Finesse), Schaden 1W4 Stichschaden

ST +2, GE +3, KO +1, IN –4, WE +2, CH +0

Trefferpunkte 4

Fertigkeit Heimlichkeit

Sinne Dunkelsicht

Bewegungsrate 30 Fuß/9 m, Klettern 30 Fuß/9 m

Speziell @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.PM5jvValFkbFH3TV]{Reittier} mit der 8. Stufe; der Biss deiner Reittarantel verursacht zusätzlich 1W4 Punkte Giftschaden, bzw. 2W4 Punkte Giftschaden, sollte die Reittarantel ein Spezialisierter Gefährte sein.

Unterstützungsvorteil Deine Reittarantel schleudert stachlige Haare nach deinem Gegner und stört seine Konzentration. Wenn du eine von deiner Reittarantel bedrohte Kreatur triffst und ihr Schaden zufügst, muss das Ziel bis zum Beginn deiner nächsten Runde einen @Check[flat|dc:5]{Einfachen Wurf} ablegen, wenn es eine Handlung der Kategorie Konzentration nutzen will. Bei Misslingen verliert das Ziel diese Handlung.

Verbessertes Manöver @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-animal-companions.AC-Advanced-Maneuvers.Item.eFZtA8LHdw4mWJVt]{Stachelhaarbeschuss}

Roc.name: Roch
Roc.description:
Dein Gefährte ist ein junges Exemplar des legendären Raubvogels.

Größenkategorie Riesig

Nahkampf 1 Schnabel, Schaden 1W10 Stichschaden

Nahkampf 1 Kralle (Agil), Schaden 1W8 Hiebschaden plus Ergreifen

ST +3, GE +1, KO +3, IN –4, WE +1, CH +0

Trefferpunkte 8

Fertigkeit Einschüchtern

Sinne Dämmersicht

Bewegungsrate 15 Fuß/4,50 m, Fliegen 60 Fuß/18 m

Speziell @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.PM5jvValFkbFH3TV]{Reittier}

Unterstützungsvorteil Dein Roch schlägt mit den Flügeln und erzeugt einen starken Luftstoß. Bis zum Beginn deines nächsten Zuges werden von dir angegriffene und von deinem Roch bedrohte Ziele, denen du Schaden zufügst, 5 Fuß/1,50 m vom Roch fortgeschoben.

Verbessertes Manöver @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-animal-companions.AC-Advanced-Maneuvers.Item.HzGLDKNJJBs7fsYN]{Schnappen}

Rootball Chair.name: Rootball Chair
Rootball Chair.description:
Your companion is a woven sphere of living plant roots that rolls over the ground, while you sit on a stabilized seat above it.

Size Medium or Large

Melee 1 vine (reach 10 feet), Damage 1d8 slashing

Str +2, Dex +2, Con +3, Int –4, Wis +1, Cha +0

Hit Points 8

Skill Stealth

Senses low-light vision

Speed 30 feet

Special mount

Support Benefit Your rootball chair moves smoothly over most terrain, thanks to its many tendrils. Your rootball chair ignores difficult terrain.

Advanced Maneuver @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-animal-companions.AC-Advanced-Maneuvers.Item.Xd4dnyHWexQRVyXn]{Seedpod Spring}

Salamander.name: Salamander
Salamander.description:
Dein Gefährte ist ein Salamander, ein Molch, ein Axolotl oder ähnliches Amphibienwesen.

Größenkategorie Klein

Nahkampf 1 Schwanz, Schaden 1W6 Wuchtschaden

Nahkampf 1 Biss, Schaden 1W4 Stichschaden

ST +2, GE +2, KO +2, IN –4, WE +1, CH +1

Trefferpunkte 6

Fertigkeit Überlebenskunde

Sinne Dunkelsicht

Bewegungsrate 20 Fuß/6 m, Schwimmen 10 Fuß/3 m

Unterstützungsvorteil Dein Salamander schwitzt ein zähflüssiges Gift aus. Bis zum Beginn deines nächsten Zuges erleidet eine zum Salamander angrenze Kreatur, die dich oder deinen Salamander trifft, @Damage[1d6[poison]]{1W6 Giftschaden}. Dieser Schaden steigt auf @Damage[2d6[poison]]2W6 Punkte}, sollte dein Salamander ein Behänder oder Wilder Gefährte sein.

Verbessertes Manöver @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-animal-companions.AC-Advanced-Maneuvers.Item.l3aasm0to5RvUkU0]{Giftiger Schwanzschlag}

Scorpion.name: Scorpion
Scorpion.description:
Your companion is one of the various species of giant scorpion.

Size Small

Melee 1 stinger, Damage 1d6 piercing plus poison (see Special)

Melee 1 pincer (agile), Damage 1d6 slashing

Str +3, Dex +3, Con +1, Int –4, Wis +1, Cha +0

Hit Points 6

Skill Stealth

Senses darkvision

Speed 30 feet

Special The scorpion's stinger attack deals an additional 1d4 poison damage or 2d4 poison damage if the scorpion is a specialized companion.

Support Benefit Your scorpion drips poison from its stinger when you create an opening. Until the start of your next turn, your Strikes that damage a creature in your scorpion's reach also deal 1d6 persistent poison damage. If your scorpion is nimble or savage, the persistent poison damage increases to 2d6.

Advanced Maneuver @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-animal-companions.AC-Advanced-Maneuvers.Item.7H8wqKtsAaSgyLyp]{Grab and Sting}

Severed Head.name: Severed Head
Severed Head.description:
Your companion is an undead severed head. The Red Revolution left countless mass graves across Galt, filled with the beheaded corpses of those executed by the final blades. Most of the victims' heads were unceremoniously dumped alongside their bodies, but many were snatched by unscrupulous necromancers who found them to be a convenient (and unfortunately plentiful) raw material for the creation of simple undead minions.

Size Small

Melee 1 jaws (agile, finesse), Damage 1d6 piercing

Str +2, Dex +1, Con +3, Int –5, Wis +0, Cha +0

Hit Points 4 (void healing)

Skill none (mindless)

Senses darkvision

Speed 15 feet, fly 25 feet

Special A severed head has the undead trait instead of the animal trait, granting it void healing and immunity to death effects, disease, and poison. It's also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-animal-companions.AC-Features.Item.CSBy1IgHTSkVAFMM]{mindless}.

Support Benefit The head latches on to your enemy with its jaws when you create an opening, distracting them and hampering their movement. The next creature within range of your severed head that you successfully Strike before the start of your next turn takes a –5-foot status penalty to its Speeds and must succeed at a @Check[flat|dc:5] to use reactions triggered by your actions until the start of your next turn. On a failure, the reaction is lost.

Advanced Maneuver @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-animal-companions.AC-Advanced-Maneuvers.Item.iG4YOq70Qs7EtnPN]{Gnash}

Shadow Hound.name: Shadow Hound
Shadow Hound.description:
Access You're a shadowcaster.

Your companion is a canine creature related to the Shadow Plane denizens known as shadow mastiffs.

Size Small

Melee 1 jaws (finesse), Damage 1d8 piercing

Str +2, Dex +3, Con +1, Int -4, Wis +1, Cha +1

Hit Points 4

Skill Intimidation

Senses darkvision, scent (imprecise) 30 feet

Speed 30 feet

Support Benefit Your shadow hound shrouds your foes in shadow when you leave an opening. Until the start of your next turn, when you damage a creature with a Strike and that creature is within reach of your shadow hound, both you and your shadow hound become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} to the creature until the end of your next turn.

Advanced Maneuver @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-animal-companions.AC-Advanced-Maneuvers.Item.EvuMVR9ut9wIHOtq]{Bay}

Shark.name: Shark
Shark.description:
Your companion is a shark of any kind, such as a hammerhead, great white, or jigsaw shark.

Size Small

Melee 1 jaws, Damage 1d8 piercing

Str +3, Dex +2, Con +2, Int –4, Wis +1, Cha +0

Hit Points 6

Skill Stealth

Senses blood scent, scent (imprecise, 60 feet)

Speed swim 40 feet

Special The shark has the aquatic trait. Its blood scent enables it to smell blood in the water from up to 1 mile away.

Support Benefit When your shark senses blood, it tears into your enemies. Until the start of your next turn, each time you hit a creature in the shark's reach with a Strike and deal slashing or piercing damage, the creature takes 1d8 slashing damage from the shark. If your shark is nimble or savage, the slashing damage increases to 2d8.

Advanced Maneuver @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-animal-companions.AC-Advanced-Maneuvers.Item.F98ajoIakyOPEuwj]{Shred}

Shotalashu.name: Schotalaschu
Shotalashu.description:
Dein Gefährte ist ein Schotalaschu (siehe Bestiarium), eine vom Planeten Castrovel stammende, telepathische Kreatur, von der mittlerweile eine kleine Population auch auf Golarion lebt. Um einen Schotalaschu zu erlangen, muss der hoffnungsvolle Reiter zuerst eine Bindung zu ihm aufbauen. Hierzu verbringen die beiden eine Woche zusammen, dann wird ein Wurf für @Check[occultism|dc:21]{Okkultismus} fällig, um eine telepathische Verbindung zu errichten. Misslingt der Wurf, kann der Reiter eine weitere Woche aufwenden und einen neuen Wurf ablegen. Sollte der Reiter über telepathische Fähigkeiten verfügen, z.B. Telepathie, Berührungstelepathie, Empathiegespür, oder Zauber wie z.B. @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.HqTI6wRrck1YXp3F]{Telepathie} wirken können, erhält er einen Situationsbonus von +4 auf diesen Wurf. Der SL hat das letzte Wort, ob eine Fähigkeit die Bedingungen erfüllt. Ist die Bindung aufgebaut, bleibt sie bestehen; keiner der Beteiligten kann eine neue Bindung aufbauen, bis einer von ihnen stirbt. Stirbt einer der Beteiligten, versetzt der Schock den Überlebenden für 24 Stunden in den Zustand @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Benommen 2} und verhindert, dass er wenigstens einen Monat lang eine neue Bindung aufbauen kann.

Ein Schotalaschu hat die Kategorie Bestie statt Tier, funktioniert ansonsten aber wie ein normaler Tiergefährte.

Größenkategorie Mittelgroß oder Groß

Nahkampf 1 Klaue (Agil), Schaden 1W6 Hiebschaden

ST +2, GE +3, KO +2, IN –3, WE +1, CH +2

Trefferpunkte 8

Fertigkeit Überlebenskunde

Sinne Dunkelsicht

Bewegungsrate 40 Fuß/12 m

Speziell @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.PM5jvValFkbFH3TV]{Reittier}

Unterstützungsvorteil Der Schotalaschu greift deinen Gegner telepathisch an, wenn du diesen ablenkst. Bis zum Beginn deines nächsten Zuges erleidet eine Kreatur innerhalb des Angriffsradius des Schotalaschus, welche du mit einem Angriff triffst, zudem 1W6 Punkte Mentalen Schaden durch den Schotalaschu. Sollte dein Schotalaschu ein Behänder oder Wilder Gefährte sein, steigt der Mentale Schaden auf 2W6 Punkte.

Verbessertes Manöver @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-animal-companions.AC-Advanced-Maneuvers.Item.i8RWZ5XkR6DYbOCp]{Telepathisch Binden}

Skeletal Bird of Prey.name: Skeletal Bird of Prey
Skeletal Bird of Prey.description:
Your companion is the skeleton of a bird of prey like a falcon or an owl.

Size Small

Melee 1 jaws (finesse), Damage 1d6 piercing

Melee 1 talon (agile, finesse), Damage 1d4 slashing

Str +2, Dex +3, Con +1, Int -5, Wis +0, Cha +0

Hit Points 4

Skill none (mindless)

Senses darkvision

Speed 10 feet, fly 50 feet

Special mindless

Support Benefit The bird flaps around and throws your foe off balance. Until the start of your next turn, when you damage a creature in the bird's reach with a Strike, that creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} until the end of your next turn.

Advanced Maneuver @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-animal-companions.AC-Advanced-Maneuvers.Item.ow3S5zhS51Nj8tsI]{Unnerving Screech}

Skeletal Constrictor.name: Skeletal Constrictor
Skeletal Constrictor.description:
Your companion is the skeleton of a constrictor snake such as a boa or python. Red lights burn deep in its eye sockets.

Size Small

Melee 1 jaws (finesse), Damage 1d8 piercing

Str +2, Dex +2, Con +1, Int -5, Wis +1, Cha +0

Hit Points 4

Skill none (mindless)

Senses darkvision

Speed 20 feet, climb 20 feet, swim 20 feet

Special mindless

Support Benefit Your snake sways, captivating an enemy. Choose one creature within 20 feet of the constrictor that can see it. Until the start of your next turn, your Strikes that deal damage to the chosen creature make the target @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} until the end of your next turn.

Advanced Maneuver @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-animal-companions.AC-Advanced-Maneuvers.Item.AH3kNbdGLYaRjVAr]{Bony Constriction}

Skeletal Mount.name: Skeletal Mount
Skeletal Mount.description:
Your companion is a skeletal horse, drake, elk, or other animal suitable for riding. Skeletal mounts can be collapsed, gathered into piles of bone, and packed away for storage.

Size Large

Melee 1 hoof (agile), Damage 1d6 bludgeoning

Str +2, Dex +2, Con +2, Int –5, Wis +0, Cha +0

Hit Points 4

Skill none (mindless)

Senses darkvision

Speed 35 feet

Special @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-animal-companions.AC-Features.Item.CSBy1IgHTSkVAFMM]{Mindless Companion}, mount

Support Benefit Your skeletal mount strikes fear when it charges. Until the start of your next turn, if you are riding your skeletal mount and move at least 10 feet on the action before your attack, any creature damaged by the attack becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} if the attack was a critical hit. This is an emotion, fear, and mental effect.

Advanced Maneuver @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-animal-companions.AC-Advanced-Maneuvers.Item.tsOaXTRWQvsKTyaL]{Gallop}

Skeletal Servant.name: Skeletal Servant
Skeletal Servant.description:
Your companion is a humanoid skeleton, mindless but capable of assisting in rudimentary chores. Like the skeletal mount, it can be collapsed for easy storage.

Size Small or Medium

Melee 1 jaws, Damage 1d8 piercing

Melee 1 claw (agile), Damage 1d6 slashing

Str +2, Dex +2, Con +1, Int –5, Wis +0, Cha +1

Hit Points 4

Skill none (mindless)

Senses darkvision

Speed 20 feet

Special @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-animal-companions.AC-Features.Item.CSBy1IgHTSkVAFMM]{Mindless Companion}

Support Benefit Your skeletal servant jabs bones into your enemies to distract them while you attack. Until the start of your next turn, when a Strike you make hits and deals damage to a creature within your skeletal servant's reach, that target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} until the end of your next turn.

Advanced Maneuver @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-animal-companions.AC-Advanced-Maneuvers.Item.6LvtdtVVwtbzqUXG]{Screaming Skull}

Snake.name: Snake
Snake.description:
Size Small

Melee 1 jaws (finesse), Damage 1d8 piercing

Str +3, Dex +3, Con +1, Int –4, Wis +1, Cha +0

Hit Points 6

Skill Stealth

Senses low-light vision, scent (imprecise, 30 feet)

Speed 20 feet, climb 20 feet, swim 20 feet

Support Benefit Your snake holds your enemies with its coils, interfering with reactions. Until the start of your next turn, any creature your snake threatens can't use reactions triggered by your actions unless its level is higher than yours.

Advanced Maneuver @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-animal-companions.AC-Advanced-Maneuvers.Item.kKW68gi1FNJlNSOp]{Constrict}

Sundaflora.name: Sundaflora
Sundaflora.description:
Sundafloras are friendly, bipedal creatures with brightly colored, overlapping waves of petal-like scales covering most of their body. Though rare to find, they're most common in the artificial garden landscapes of Goka, usually seen waltzing around the grounds with their hands clasped together, giving off a pensive appearance.

Size Small

Melee 1 claws (agile), Damage 1d6 slashing

Melee 1 clubbed tail, Damage 1d8 bludgeoning

Str +2, Dex +3, Con +1, Int –4, Wis +1, Cha +1

Hit Points 6

Skill Performance

Senses low-light vision, scent (imprecise, 30 feet)

Speed 20 feet, swim 15 feet

Support Benefit Your sundaflora inspires your allies with its calm demeanor and agile steps. Choose one ally within 30 feet of your sundaflora. They gain a +1 circumstance bonus to their next attack roll to Strike a foe within your sundaflora's reach. The bonus lasts until the first time your ally uses it or until the beginning of your next turn, whichever comes first.

Advanced Maneuver @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-animal-companions.AC-Advanced-Maneuvers.Item.uhv8V9STpaCXdkCf]{Flower Dance}

Terror Bird.name: Terror Bird
Terror Bird.description:
Your companion is a terror bird, a large species of flightless carnivorous avian.

Size Large

Melee 1 beak, Damage 1d8 piercing

Melee 1 talon (agile), Damage 1d6 piercing

Str +3, Dex +2, Con +2, Int –4, Wis +1, Cha +0

Hit Points 8

Skill Survival

Senses low-light vision

Speed 40 feet

Special mount

Support Benefit Your terror bird screeches at your enemies when you create an opening. Until the start of your next turn, your Strikes that deal damage to a creature within your terror bird's reach make the target @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg] until the start of your next turn.

Advanced Maneuver @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-animal-companions.AC-Advanced-Maneuvers.Item.TCEQtO5DawzVAIyT]{Tearing Clutch}

Tikar Urchinpad.name: Tikar Urchinpad
Tikar Urchinpad.description:
Tikar urchinpads are curious creatures that look similar to jellyfish, have heads that resemble a floating plant or pad, and make use of their slimy tendrils to consume creatures that attempt to rest on the urchinpad's head. Tikar urchinpads tend to float about in still water, soaking in the warmth of sunlight, not a care in the world. To the untrained eye, they appear only as a myriad of small, colorful squares sprawled out across a round pad, forming silhouettes of shapes that dazzle across the water's surface.

Size Small or Medium

Melee 1 tendril (agile, finesse), Damage 1d6 slashing

Str +2, Dex +3, Con +2, Int –4, Wis +1, Cha +0

Hit Points 6

Skill Stealth

Senses scent (precise, 10 feet)

Speed 10 feet, swim 40 feet

Support Benefit Your tikar urchinpad attempts to wrap its tendrils around your foe's limbs, pulling it off balance. Until the end of your next turn, as long as you're adjacent to your urchinpad, if you attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.7blmbDrQFNfdT731]{Shove} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.ge56Lu1xXVFYUnLP]{Trip} an opponent and roll a critical failure, you get a failure instead.

Advanced Maneuver @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-animal-companions.AC-Advanced-Maneuvers.Item.5x3uxG6DYwSIrN30]{Wrapping Tendrils}

Triceratops.name: Triceratops
Triceratops.description:
Your companion is a triceratops or other armored dinosaur. If necessary, change the horn attack and damage type to an appropriate attack for the dinosaur (for example, an ankylosaurus would have a tail attack that deals bludgeoning damage).

Size Large

Melee 1 horn, Damage 1d8 piercing

Melee 1 foot, Damage 1d6 bludgeoning

Str +3, Dex +1, Con +2, Int –4, Wis +2, Cha +0

Hit Points 8

Skill Intimidation

Senses low-light vision, scent (imprecise, 30 feet)

Speed 25 feet

Special mount

Support Benefit Your triceratops gores @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} targets in your wake. Until the start of your next turn, your Strikes that damage a prone creature in your triceratops's reach also deal 1d8 persistent bleed damage. If your triceratops is nimble or savage, the persistent bleed damage increases to 2d8.

Advanced Maneuver @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-animal-companions.AC-Advanced-Maneuvers.Item.H1ElYt6KovGYGzLD]{Lumbering Knockdown}

Tyrannosaurus.name: Tyrannosaurus
Tyrannosaurus.description:
Your companion is a tyrannosaurus, allosaurus, or similar large, carnivorous dinosaur.

Size Large

Melee 1 jaws, Damage 1d8 piercing

Melee 1 foot, Damage 1d6 bludgeoning

Str +3, Dex +1, Con +3, Int –4, Wis +1, Cha +0

Hit Points 8

Skill Intimidation

Senses low-light vision, scent (imprecise, 30 feet)

Speed 35 feet

Support Benefit Your tyrannosaurus roars and puts on a fearsome display as you attack, startling your foes. Until the start of your next turn, if you hit and deal damage to a creature within your tyrannosaurus's reach, the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.

Advanced Maneuver @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-animal-companions.AC-Advanced-Maneuvers.Item.yXw82Zd5nkcCUfRQ]{Overwhelm}

Ulgrem-Lurann.name: Ulgrem-Lurann
Ulgrem-Lurann.description:
Your companion is one of the few surviving members of a formerly lost species, hatched from the last clutch of Ulgrem-Axaan. As it's so young, its intelligence hasn't developed yet, but some day, it will become a highly intelligent creature. An Ulgrem-Lurann has the beast trait instead of the animal trait but otherwise functions normally as an animal companion.

Size Medium

Melee 1 jaws, Damage 1d8 piercing

Melee 1 tail, Damage 1d6 bludgeoning

Str +3, Dex +2, Con +2, Int –4, Wis 0, Cha +1

Hit Points 6

Skill Intimidation

Senses darkvision

Speed 20 feet, swim 25 feet

Special The Ulgrem-Lurann has the amphibious trait.

Support Benefit The Ulgrem-Lurann grabs at your foe and zaps it. Until the start of your next turn, each time you hit a creature in the Ulgrem-Lurann's reach with a Strike, the creature takes an additional 1d4 piercing damage and 1d4 electricity damage from the Ulgrem-Lurann. If the Ulgrem-Lurann is nimble or savage, the piercing damage and electricity damage each increase to 2d4.

Advanced Maneuver @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-animal-companions.AC-Advanced-Maneuvers.Item.Upr7u0KhPAIMOqXv]{Snatch and Zap}

Umbrella Mushroom.name: Riesenschirmling
Umbrella Mushroom.description:
Dein Gefährte ist ein Pilz mit breiter Kappe, der auf den Luftströmungen treiben kann. Er verfügt über eine Schlaufe am Fuß des Stieles, die als Steigbügel genutzt werden kann. Ein Riesenschirmling besitzt die Kategorie Fungus statt Tier, funktioniert ansonsten aber wie ein Tiergefährte

.

Größenkategorie Groß

Nahkampf 1 Stiel, Schaden 1W8 Wuchtschaden

ST +2, GE +2, KO +3, IN –4, WE +1, CH +0

Trefferpunkte 6

Fertigkeit Heimlichkeit

Sinne Dämmersicht

Bewegungsrate 15 Fuß/4,50 m, Fliegen 30 Fuß/9 m

Speziell @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.PM5jvValFkbFH3TV]{Reittier}; nutzt du bei deinem Schirmpilz Tier anweisen, erlangt er eine Reaktion, die er nur für sein Verbessertes Manöver Fallschirm nutzen kann.

Unterstützungsvorteil Dein Riesenschirmling stößt Sporen aus, welche die Sinne abstumpfen, wenn dein Gegner eine Schwachstelle zeigt. Bis zum Beginn deines nächsten Zuges erhalten Gegner im Angriffsradius deines Pilzes, die du angreifst und denen du Schaden zufügst, 1 Runde lang den Zustand @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Benommen 1}. Dieser Effekt hat die Kategorie Gift.

Verbessertes Manöver @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-animal-companions.AC-Advanced-Maneuvers.Item.VSsW37hmpmXNOUwd]{Fallschirm}

Undead Hand.name: Undead Hand
Undead Hand.description:
Your companion is a large skeletal or fleshy humanoid hand, similar to a giant crawling hand.

Size Small

Melee 1 claw (agile, finesse), Damage 1d6 slashing

Str +2, Dex +2, Con +1, Int -5, Wis +1, Cha +0

Hit Points 4

Skill none (mindless)

Senses darkvision

Speed 20 feet, climb 20 feet

Special mindless

Support Benefit The hand viciously batters the foes you attack. Until the start of your next turn, each time you hit a creature in the hand's reach with a Strike, the creature takes 1d6 bludgeoning damage from the hand. If your hand is nimble or savage, the bludgeoning damage increases to 2d6.

Advanced Maneuver @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-animal-companions.AC-Advanced-Maneuvers.Item.MQv67R7KBIrJkshN]{Grip Throat}

Vampiric Animal.name: Vampiric Animal
Vampiric Animal.description:
Your companion is a wolf, weasel, fox, or other predator with fangs and the blood thirst of a vampire. They often serve vampires who willingly shared their blood to bind the animal to their vampiric whims.

Size Small or Medium

Melee 1 jaws (finesse), Damage 1d8 piercing

Str +2, Dex +2, Con +1, Int –4, Wis +1, Cha +0

Hit Points 4

Skill Survival

Senses low‑light vision, scent (imprecise 30 feet)

Speed 30 feet

Special Vampiric animal companions are particularly attuned to the scent of blood. If a creature has persistent bleed damage, your vampiric animal companion can smell the creature if it's within 120 feet rather than 30 feet.

Support Benefit When your vampiric animal senses blood it tears into your enemies. Until the start of your next turn, your Strikes that damage a creature in your vampiric animal's reach also deal 1d6 persistent bleed damage. If your vampiric animal is nimble or savage, the persistent bleed damage increases to 2d6.

Advanced Maneuver @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-animal-companions.AC-Advanced-Maneuvers.Item.cVrW2GGLVpydj8h5]{Blood Feast}

Vulture.name: Vulture
Vulture.description:
Your companion is a vulture, condor, or other large scavenging bird.

Size Small

Melee 1 jaws (finesse), Damage 1d8 piercing

Str +2, Dex +2, Con +2, Int –4, Wis +2, Cha +0

Hit Points 6

Skill Survival

Senses low-light vision, scent (imprecise, 30 feet)

Speed 10 feet, fly 45 feet

Special Your vulture gains a +1 status bonus to all saves against disease, and if it rolls a success on a save against a disease, the result is a critical success instead.

Support Benefit The vulture retches and vomits onto a foe within 10 feet.
